page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Many people living in Crowborough commute to London, Tunbridge Wells or other towns in Kent & Sussex because property is cheaper than in their work place. 350_400 travel by train to Victoria using an annual season ticket costing Â£1044. Jarvis Brook Industrial Estate provides work for about 400, Servomex employing 260 and Sahara Windows 60. Small privately owned businesses are popular & many mothers supplement family income working as shop assistants, cleaners, secretaries The majority of people in Rotherfield are farmers, either owning or renting their land. Shops are manned by local residents. There is a Careers Dept. at Beacon School and jobs are advertised within the town and local newspapers. Unemployment in Crowboro' is 2_3% and 5% in Wealden. Compared to national figures of 3 million this is low.
